page.title: 13HANNINGTON T.V. MAST
page.content: The most prominent feature of this area is the mast on{Cottington Hill near{Hannington.}It is run by the BBC, but is also used by ITV. The mast is 500 feet tall, and a man called a rigger has to climb it and check that everything is in order, and to replace the warning lights. There are fifteen lights, three on each stage. Below the mast are some buildings used by the{Home Office,}who own the site. They fit and repair the radios used by the police, fire and ambulance services. There are twenty-six people working there. Other buildings belong to the BBC, and are used for all the technical work on the mast and for transmitting television pictures. Aerials collect signals and pass them to other masts in the area.
